definitions.definition: the pointed top of a mountain.
examples: the snowy peaks rose against the blue of a cloudless sky

definitions.definition: a mountain, especially one with a pointed top.
examples: the rocky outcrops of peaks such as the Cassongrat offer a challenge to rock climbers

definitions.definition: a projecting pointed part or shape.
examples: whisk 2 egg whites to stiff peaks

definitions.definition: a point in a curve or on a graph, or a value of a physical quantity, higher than those around it.
examples: a slight increase in velocity provides a second peak on the general velocity curve

definitions.definition: the point of highest activity, quality, or achievement.
examples: anyone who saw Jones at his peak looked upon genius

definitions.definition: a stiff brim at the front of a cap.
examples: brim, visor the peak of a cap

definitions.definition: the narrow part of a ship's hold at the bow or stern.
the upper, outer corner of a sail extended by a gaff.
reach a highest point, either of a specified value or at a specified time.
synonyms: come to a head "conservative support has peaked"

definitions.definition: decline in health and spirits; waste away.
